image.altText: A CFS firefighter in firefighting helmet and clothing.

props.synopsis: Emergency authorities are paying tribute to Country Fire Service firefighter Peter Curtis, who died in the line of duty at a conservation park on South Australia's Eyre Peninsula.

title.children: 'Much-loved' firefighter dies at scene of Eyre Peninsula blaze

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: SA Police says it will restart its search for four-year-old Gus, who went missing in the state's Mid North almost two months ago.

title.children: SA Police to restart search for 4yo Gus, six mine shafts to be searched

image.altText: A man on a green tractor clearing downed trees.

props.synopsis: Port Pirie residents and businesses are picking up the pieces after record-breaking thunderstorms hit town over the weekend.

title.children: Clean-up underway following destructive thunderstorms in Port Pirie

image.altText: Golden wheat in the sunshine.

props.synopsis: ElectraNet are shifting their focus east, after farmers voiced concerns about renewable energy line Northern Transmission Project running through prime cropping country.

title.children: ElectraNet to change power corridor plan after farmers voice concerns

image.altText: An overhead view of an outback spring.

props.synopsis: The Great Artesian Basin covers a fifth of Australia and contains water that has been there for millions of years. Now, decades of extraction are taking their toll and traditional owners are fighting a mining giant for compensation.

title.children: Water is under pressure in the Great Artesian Basin

image.altText: Arabana ranger Zaaheer McKenzie at the site of a spring.

props.synopsis: Environmentalists are calling for mining giant BHP to end its water extraction from the Great Artesian Basin when a major desalination plant is built in South Australia's north.

title.children: Calls for BHP to end water extraction before culturally significant springs are lost

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt sitting in a wheelchair on a ramp at the back of a vehicle next to a man in a checked shirt

props.synopsis: When there are so few taxis in your regional city that you can actually use, it can be detrimental to your independence when it no longer shows up.

title.children: City's only wheelchair taxi missing in action leaving customers in limbo

image.altText: A wide shot of Mount Gambier's Blue Lake.

props.synopsis: Most lakes are kind of blue, but this lake in South Australia stands out for its super-bright colour that attracts tourists from around the country. But just why it is so blue and why it changes colour during the year are not well known.

title.children: Why is Mount Gambier's Blue Lake so blue?

image.altText: A man hold up a light to a large hole in the ceiling, debris all over the kitchen counter and floor

props.synopsis: Thousands of residents were faced with outages in the South Australian town of Port Pirie after a severe thunderstorm and hail destroyed roofs as well as bringing down trees and powerlines.

title.children: SA town experiences "most significant storm event" on record

image.altText: A screen with YouTube on it. A person hands appear, blurred, near the screen. The background is bright pink and blue.

props.synopsis: BTN High tests what YouTube content will be viewable without an account ahead of next month's social media ban, as an academic says the restrictions are unlikely to change what young people are watching.

title.children: Will teens without accounts be safe on YouTube under social media ban?

image.altText: Valentino Yuel dribbles the ball in an Asian Champions League game

props.synopsis: Since becoming a professional, Valentino Yuel has played in Australia's A-League, as well as for clubs in Türkiye, Iran, Qatar, Uzbekistan, Libya and now Hong Kong.

title.children: Footballer's 'fascination' for different cultures sees him globetrotting with clubs

image.altText: The SA flag flies above South Australia's Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Four and a half years after a landmark review into sexual harassment, South Australia's Parliament has been accused of moving at a "glacial pace" on workplace reforms, with a new report revealing staff concerns about power imbalances and a "deeply ingrained culture of favouritism".

title.children: Favouritism, fear and double standards: SA Parliament's culture under fire

image.altText: A man without a shirt wearing a blue hat poses for a photo by a lake with kids.

props.synopsis: Olympic gold medal-winning swimmer Kyle Chalmers is inspiring young and aspiring athletes, and speaking about the importance of mental health.

title.children: Olympic gold medalist swaps coast for the outback on mental health tour

image.altText: Dark clouds over a pool and trees in background.

props.synopsis: Residents in far-north WA are being warned of expected damaging wind and heavy rain today as Cyclone Fina approaches the Kimberley region.

title.children: Far-north WA residents expecting damaging wind and rain as Cyclone Fina approaches

image.altText: Digitally blurred people leaning over the side of a rubber dinghy collecting bags from the ocean.

props.synopsis: Police charge the chief officer of an international livestock carrier and three others, after half a tonne of cocaine was found floating off Western Australia's coast.

title.children: Half tonne of cocaine retrieved from WA waters, as livestock vessel chief charged

image.altText: An Australian bowler holds the ball as he gestures to the captain on the ground during a Test.

props.synopsis: Australia coach Andrew McDonald provides an update on sidelined quicks Pat Cummins and Josh Hazlewood ahead of the second Ashes Test at the Gabba.

title.children: Australia gives latest on injured pace aces Hazlewood and Cummins

image.altText: A headshot of Sussan Ley speaking.

props.synopsis: The optics of rolling the Liberal Party's only woman leader when NSW and Victoria have managed to elevate traditional "small-l liberal" candidates is playing on the minds of some members.

title.children: Ley faces big test and also a big opportunity in final week

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt standing next to decorative desserts.

props.synopsis: Skye Gyngell was born in Sydney into a prominent broadcast family but made her mark globally as a "culinary visionary who influenced generations of chefs".

title.children: Tributes flow after Australian Michelin star chef Skye Gyngell dies

image.altText: Big red ship docked in water.

props.synopsis: The auditor-general who said Tasmania's ferry operator was operating while insolvent, has been told his comments were "causing real harm to the company and its stakeholders".

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania chair says it would be 'perverse' to let company go under

image.altText: GettyImages-2248026288

props.synopsis: McLaren apologies to Norris and Piastri as F1 officials explain why the drivers were disqualified in Las Vegas.

title.children: What did McLaren do wrong in shock disqualification at Las Vegas GP?

image.altText: Close-up image of David Cameron. He has a smile on his face.

props.synopsis: A biopsy showed he had prostate cancer, to which the former British prime minister said, "You always dread hearing those words."

title.children: David Cameron reveals he has been treated for prostate cancer

image.altText: An orange BHP logo on a grey background.

props.synopsis: Preliminary talks between miners BHP and Anglo American end without a deal. The ASX rebounds more than 1 per cent after renewed hopes of a December rate cut powered Wall Street higher. Here's how the session played out.

title.children: BHP unable to reach takeover deal with Anglo American — as it happened

image.altText: Close-up of man pouring glass of pet nat wine.

props.synopsis: Central-west New South Wales winemaker Sam Statham has noticed a trend that has nothing to do with price or palate.

title.children: A new vintage: Why gen Z and millennials favour organic wines

image.altText: A man types on a laptop computer which is resting on his lap. The background is lit with red light.

props.synopsis: Whether you're an employee counting down the days until your break, or an employer trying to keep a business open over Christmas — what are the rules about working these holidays?

title.children: Do I have to work over the holidays, or use up leave if my workplace shuts?

image.altText: A woman stands with arms crossed in front of a bus.

props.synopsis: A Rail, Tram and Bus Union (RTBU) survey finds 73 per cent of female transport workers have suffered health issues due to inadequate toilet facilities.

title.children: Female transport workers exposed to 'horrendous', unsafe toilets on shift

image.altText: A robot with a human-like face with its arms held high. Behind it is a red backdrop with white writing.

props.synopsis: There is now a global race to build humanoids that can walk, talk, reason, lift, carry, fetch, stack and generally operate in a human environment.

title.children: Humanoid robots will change work forever

image.altText: a beach closed sign on a sandy beach, there is water behind it

props.synopsis: A body has been found in a major land and sea search following a young man being swept out to sea on the NSW Central Coast.

title.children: Body found in search for 18yo man swept out to sea after sandbank collapse

image.altText: A woman in an orange shirt poses in front of an abc banner

props.synopsis: The presenter will move to the NSW Weekend Mornings on Sundays, while NewsRadio's Thomas Oriti will step into the Drive hosting chair.

title.children: Chris Bath to depart ABC Radio Sydney Drive in move to Sundays

image.altText: Lisa Seeger uses a curling wand to curl a woman's hair.

props.synopsis: Australians are finding it harder to change jobs. It comes at a time when artificial intelligence is poised to further disrupt the workforce.

title.children: 'It's been really disheartening': The reality of trying to find a new job

image.altText: woman is escorted to a seat inside a courtroom by a police man

props.synopsis: in 2014, Morgan Geyser and an accomplice nearly stabbed a classmate to death and later told police they did so to earn the right to be Slender Man's servants.

title.children: Woman behind Slender Man stabbing in 2014 is now missing

image.altText: A satellite view shows water in a dam surrounded by mountains

props.synopsis: As Iran suffers through a drought and the president warns the capital could be evacuated, millions are worried about what the future will hold.

title.children: Tehran close to running dry due to 'water bankruptcy'

image.altText: Aerial footage of the Train's home showing two front steps and water tanks.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest does not fault police or the government for failing to pick up the curdling paranoia of the deluded Train family, but it does offer some paths forward.

title.children: The horror of Wieambilla couldn’t be predicted, but extreme violence can be prevented

image.altText: Marco Rubio, wearing a red tie and a dark suit, speaks in front of a Ukrainian flag

props.synopsis: The US and Ukraine say they have created an "updated and refined peace framework" to end the war with Russia, apparently modifying a Trump-backed plan Kyiv and its allies saw as too sympathetic to Moscow.

title.children: Rubio touts Ukraine peace talks as Trump says Kyiv shows 'zero gratitude'

image.altText: A portrait-style photo of a middle-aged Lebanese man with a short grey beard wearing a baseball cap and military fatigues.

props.synopsis: The strike on Lebanon's capital is the first by Israel since June, and follows intensifying attacks on southern Lebanon in recent weeks.

title.children: Israel kills Hezbollah's military chief in Beirut air strike

image.altText: A pair of sandals sits in the foreground of an empty school dormitory filled with metal bed frames.

props.synopsis: However, more than 250 students and 12 staff members are still being held, in what is one of the worst mass kidnappings ever recorded in the country.

title.children: Fifty kidnapped Catholic school students escape captors in Nigeria
